trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Pig in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Pig in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Pig with Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Pig with Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Use Pig with Hadoop on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use Pig with Hadoop on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Apache Pig is a platform for creating programs for Hadoop by using a procedural language known as Pig Latin.
trans-unit.target: Apache Pig is a platform for creating programs for Hadoop by using a procedural language known as Pig Latin.

trans-unit.source: Pig is an alternative to Java for creating MapReduce solutions, and it is included with Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Pig is an alternative to Java for creating MapReduce solutions, and it is included with Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how you can use Pig with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how you can use Pig with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Why use Pig?
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Why use Pig?

trans-unit.source: One of the challenges of processing data by using MapReduce in Hadoop is implementing your processing logic by using only a map and a reduce function.
trans-unit.target: One of the challenges of processing data by using MapReduce in Hadoop is implementing your processing logic by using only a map and a reduce function.

trans-unit.source: For complex processing, you often have to break processing into multiple MapReduce operations that are chained together to achieve the desired result.
trans-unit.target: For complex processing, you often have to break processing into multiple MapReduce operations that are chained together to achieve the desired result.

trans-unit.source: Instead of forcing you to use only map and reduce functions, Pig allows you to define processing as a series of transformations that the data flows through to produce the desired output.
trans-unit.target: Instead of forcing you to use only map and reduce functions, Pig allows you to define processing as a series of transformations that the data flows through to produce the desired output.

trans-unit.source: The Pig Latin language allows you to describe the data flow from raw input, through one or more transformations, to produce the desired output.
trans-unit.target: The Pig Latin language allows you to describe the data flow from raw input, through one or more transformations, to produce the desired output.

trans-unit.source: Pig Latin programs follow this general pattern:
trans-unit.target: Pig Latin programs follow this general pattern:

trans-unit.source: Load: Read data to be manipulated from the file system
trans-unit.target: Load: Read data to be manipulated from the file system

trans-unit.source: Transform: Manipulate the data
trans-unit.target: Transform: Manipulate the data

trans-unit.source: Dump or store: Output data to the screen or store it for processing
trans-unit.target: Dump or store: Output data to the screen or store it for processing

trans-unit.source: Pig Latin also supports user-defined functions (UDF), which allows you to invoke external components that implement logic that is difficult to model in Pig Latin.
trans-unit.target: Pig Latin also supports user-defined functions (UDF), which allows you to invoke external components that implement logic that is difficult to model in Pig Latin.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Pig Latin, see <link><linkText>Pig Latin Reference Manual 1</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Pig Latin Reference Manual 2</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Pig Latin, see <link><linkText>Pig Latin Reference Manual 1</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Pig Latin Reference Manual 2</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For an example of using UDFs with Pig, see the following documents:
trans-unit.target: For an example of using UDFs with Pig, see the following documents:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Using Python with Pig and Hive in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Using Python with Pig and Hive in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use C# with Hive and Pig in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>About the sample data
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>About the sample data

trans-unit.source: This example uses a log4j sample file, which is stored at /example/data/sample.log in your blob storage container.
trans-unit.target: This example uses a log4j sample file, which is stored at /example/data/sample.log in your blob storage container.

trans-unit.source: Each log inside the file consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field to show the type and the severity, for example:
trans-unit.target: Each log inside the file consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field to show the type and the severity, for example:

trans-unit.source: In the previous example, the log level is ERROR.
trans-unit.target: In the previous example, the log level is ERROR.

trans-unit.source: You can also generate a log4j file by using the <link><linkText>Apache Log4j</linkText><title></title></link> logging tool and then upload that file to your blob.
trans-unit.target: You can also generate a log4j file by using the <link><linkText>Apache Log4j</linkText><title></title></link> logging tool and then upload that file to your blob.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Upload Data to HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link> for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Upload Data to HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link> for instructions.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how blobs in Azure storage are used with HDInsight, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how blobs in Azure storage are used with HDInsight, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The sample data is stored in Azure Blob storage, which HDInsight uses as the default file system for Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: The sample data is stored in Azure Blob storage, which HDInsight uses as the default file system for Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight can access files stored in blobs by using the wasb prefix.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight can access files stored in blobs by using the wasb prefix.

trans-unit.source: For example, to access the sample.log file, you would use the following syntax:
trans-unit.target: For example, to access the sample.log file, you would use the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: Because WASB is the default storage for HDInsight, you can also access the file by using /example/data/sample.log from Pig Latin.
trans-unit.target: Because WASB is the default storage for HDInsight, you can also access the file by using /example/data/sample.log from Pig Latin.

trans-unit.source: The syntax, wasb:///, is used to access files stored in the default storage container for your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The syntax, wasb:///, is used to access files stored in the default storage container for your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you specified additional storage accounts when you provisioned your cluster, and you want to access files stored in these accounts, you can access the data by specifying the container name and storage account address, for example: wasb://mycontainer@mystorage.blob.core.windows.net/example/data/sample.log.
trans-unit.target: If you specified additional storage accounts when you provisioned your cluster, and you want to access files stored in these accounts, you can access the data by specifying the container name and storage account address, for example: wasb://mycontainer@mystorage.blob.core.windows.net/example/data/sample.log.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>About the sample job
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>About the sample job

trans-unit.source: The following Pig Latin job loads the sample.log file from the default storage for your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following Pig Latin job loads the sample.log file from the default storage for your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Then it performs a series of transformations that result in a count of how many times each log level occurred in the input data.
trans-unit.target: Then it performs a series of transformations that result in a count of how many times each log level occurred in the input data.

trans-unit.source: The results are dumped into STDOUT.
trans-unit.target: The results are dumped into STDOUT.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows a breakdown of what each transformation does to the data.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows a breakdown of what each transformation does to the data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Graphical representation of the transformations</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Graphical representation of the transformations</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Run the Pig Latin job
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Run the Pig Latin job

trans-unit.source: HDInsight can run Pig Latin jobs by using a variety of methods.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight can run Pig Latin jobs by using a variety of methods.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to decide which method is right for you, then follow the link for a walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to decide which method is right for you, then follow the link for a walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: Running Pig jobs on Azure HDInsight using on-premises SQL Server Integration Services
trans-unit.target: Running Pig jobs on Azure HDInsight using on-premises SQL Server Integration Services

trans-unit.source: You can also use SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to run a Pig job.
trans-unit.target: You can also use SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to run a Pig job.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Feature Pack for SSIS provides the following components that work with Pig jobs on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Feature Pack for SSIS provides the following components that work with Pig jobs on HDInsight.
